completions.nl_description: Recolor all objects to their corresponding distinct colors as follows: replace X with G, B with G, and G with B.
completions.code:
(do
    (rule
        (vars (this))
        (filter (color_equals (color_of this) X))
        (apply (update_color G))
    )
    (rule
        (vars (this))
        (filter (color_equals (color_of this) G))
        (apply (update_color B))
    )
)

completions.nl_description: Recolor objects to color B, G, or R based on their previous color.
Recolor all objects of color X: objects in the first grid get recolored to their random number corresponding to their position, but starting from top-left: B, G, R.

Change the color of all 'X' objects in the input grids to 'B', all neighboring objects of 'X' in the first pair to 'G', and all fields in contact with 'X' on the diagonal in the extra pairs to 'R' and 'G'.
Recolor all objects of color X with different colors.
Recolor objects of color X to different colors.
Recolor objects in different colors based on their vertical position.
Recolor all objects to different colors based on the quadrants in which they are located.
Recolor all objects to color matching their neighbors, when the color of the neighbor is X.
Recolor objects by moving them up one step if their size equals 2, and changing their color to an adjacent object's color
Recolor all objects of color X to their own distinct new colors.
Recolor all objects to different colors: X to B, G to R, and Y to G.
Recolor all objects to their unique color based on their initial positioning, with a sequence of predefined colors.
Recolor objects of color X to different colors based on neighboring objects.
Recolor all objects from their current color to a new unique color.
completions.code:
(do
    (rule
        (vars (this))
        (filter (color_equals (color_of this) X))
        (apply (update_color B))
    )
    (rule
        (vars (this))
        (filter (color_equals (color_of this) B))
        (apply (update_color R))
    )
    (rule
        (vars (this))
        (filter (color_equals (color_of this) R))
        (apply (update_color G))
    )
)

completions.nl_description: Recolor objects of color X in each input grid to different colors.
Recolor all objects to colors G, B, or R for different instances of X objects.
Recolor all objects to distinct colors: G, B, or R, while preserving their initial configuration.
Recolor all objects of color X. First recolor the objects of size 4 to color B, then the objects of size 2 to color G, and finally the objects of size 1 to color R.
Recolor all X objects to one of the following colors based on the input grid: B, G, or R.
Recolor all the objects to different colors based on their size and position:
completions.code:
(do
 (rule
   (vars (this other))
   (filter
     (and
       (neighbor_of this other)
       (color_equals (color_of other) X)))
   (apply
     (update_color B)
     (move_node_max (direction_of other))
  )
 )
 (rule
   (vars (this))
   (filter)
   (apply
     (update_color R)))
 (rule
   (vars (this))
   (filter)
   (apply
    (update_color G)
  )
 )
 (rule 
    (vars (this))
    (filter)
    (apply
     (update_color B)
  )
 ))

completions.nl_description: Recolor all objects to color G if they are neighbors of an object of color X, otherwise recolor them to color R.
Recolor all objects of color X. If the object is in first pair grid, recolor to B, if it is in the second pair grid, recolor to R, and if it is in the third pair grid, recolor to G.
Recolor all objects of color X to G if they are part of the main diagonal, otherwise recolor them to B and neighbors of an X object with color R are recolored to R.
Recolor all objects to color R, G, or B depending on their position relative to the maximum object.
Recolor all the objects of color X to different colors in a pattern.
Recolor all objects of color X to different colors.
Recolor objects that are neighbors of grey objects. They should be colored in a sequence of B, G, R respectively.
Recolor all objects to B if they are on the left, to G if they are on the top left, and to R if they are on the top right.
Recolor all objects to color B, G, or R, moving objects one step up if needed.
completions.code:
(do
    (rule
        (vars (this))
        (filter (size_equals (size_of this) 2))
        (apply (update_color B))
    )
    (rule
        (vars (this))
        (filter (size_equals (size_of this) 2))
        (apply (move_node up))
    )
    (rule
        (vars (this))
        (filter (size_equals (size_of this) 3))
        (apply (update_color G))
    )
    (rule
        (vars (this))
        (filter (size_equals (size_of this) 3))
        (apply (move_node up))
    )
    (rule
        (vars (this))
        (filter (size_equals (size_of this) 4))
        (apply (update_color R))
    )
    (rule
        (vars (this))
        (filter (size_equals (size_of this) 4))
        (apply (move_node up))
    )
)

completions.nl_description: Recolor all objects of color X to a different color from the list B, G, and R, based on their original position.
Change the color of all X objects to match the surrounding neighbors: top-left X to G, other Xs in the same rows/columns to their neighbor's colors, and the bottom-right X to R.
completions.code:
(do
    (rule
        (vars (this other))
        (filter (and (color_equals (color_of this) X) (neighbor_of this other)))
        (apply (update_color (color_of other)))
    )
)

completions.nl_description: Recolor all objects from X to different colors in a specific pattern for each grid.
